intro: Ononis elongata, commonly known as slender restharrow, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant features slender, branching stems with small, narrow leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically pale blue or purple and bloom in early spring. Ononis elongata is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
